data.title: Is Gerald Wallace an All
data.meta_description: 16.1 points, 12.3 rebounds (leading the NBA from the SF position) and 1.6 steals. The Bobcats are 9-11, which is good for 7th in the East as of today. Is he an All-Star reserve if the team keeps winning and he keeps putting up these numbers?
data.text:
16.1 points, 12.3 rebounds (leading the NBA from the SF position) and 1.6 steals. The Bobcats are 9-11, which is good for 7th in the East as of today. Is he an All-Star reserve if the team keeps winning and he keeps putting up these numbers?

Not necesarily… If anything, Jackson has helped Wallace. He no longer has to be the team’s top offensive option. He plays well off of Jackson on offensive, plus he can focus on doing all the dirty work like rebounding and playing D.

I think he’s on the outside looking in. I think Josh Smith should have the SF spot as a backup. Smith has been more impressive than Wallace from what I’ve seen this year. But Wallace has been a good player for Charlotte this year..

Personal opinion? Yes, easily. But the NBA All-Star game isn’t the top players from each conference it’s more or less a popularity contest for the fan voting aspect and then a prestige thing when the coaches pick…I hope he makes it though. If he does it will be because of his hustle and the rebounds hes pulling down for his position. I think people are beginning to take notice

Wallace is one of those players who won’t really need a lot of offensive touches to score… That’s the good thing about him. He’s sort of like Shawn Marion. He can give you 15+ points without having too many plays ran for him.

To me he’s a better, more efficient young Marion. I think with the year he’s having on top of the games he had against James and Anthony he’ll sneak in as a reserve. He certainly deserves it.

the fans that vote are brain-dead pieces of garbage…they have tracy mcgrady being an all-star and the guy hasnt played at all this year, heres how horrible NBA fans are (besides the guys on this site that actually know what theyre talking about)

East will be:

G-Wade

G-Iverson

C-Shaq

F-Garnett

F-LeBron

west:

G-Kobe

G-McGrady

C-Yao

F-Duncan

F-Melo

coach will vote in iggy and wallace we should all vote for them to because there having better years then any forwards in the east

so come on vote for andre and gerald

lets get players who deserve it into the all star game

You all have made good points. Here’s my assessment……….. Steven Jackson will make the all-star if the Bobcats continue winning instead of Wallace.

Dhamp2…the greatest basketball mind in the world. Next to Hubie Brown anyway.

Andy Rautins may be drafted after all….very late in the second round

Bring back the Fab 5

Steve Lavin please coach again
